• The Pistons were careless with the basketball, turning it over on 21% of their possessions as Cleveland's pressure defense forced Detroit into costly mistakes throughout the game

• Cleveland managed to take care of the ball reasonably well despite turning it over on 17% of their possessions, doing enough to avoid giving Detroit extra opportunities in transition

• Cleveland shot a solid 52% effective field goal percentage, finding good looks against Detroit's defense to maintain offensive flow

• Detroit dominated the offensive glass with an outstanding 31% offensive rebounding rate, creating second-chance opportunities even as their initial shots weren't falling

• The Cavaliers got to the charity stripe frequently with an excellent free throw rate of 32%, drawing fouls and adding easy points at the line

22500114.eight_factors:
• Philadelphia took excellent care of the basketball with a 94% ball handling rate, creating a massive advantage in what became a high-scoring affair won by the 76ers 136-124

• Orlando's red-hot shooting performance with a 60% effective field goal percentage kept them competitive despite falling short, as the Magic knocked down shots at an elite clip

• The Magic dominated the offensive glass with a 34% offensive rebounding rate, generating crucial second-chance opportunities in the high-octane contest

• Orlando was aggressive attacking the rim and drew fouls at an excellent rate, attempting free throws on 32% of their field goal attempts

• Philadelphia complemented their ball security with solid shooting at 57% effective field goal percentage, providing the offensive balance needed to outscore a potent Magic attack

• The 76ers crashed the offensive boards effectively with a 32% offensive rebounding rate, helping sustain possessions in their home victory

• Philadelphia's excellent free throw rate of 27% added to their offensive efficiency, as they consistently got to the charity stripe throughout the contest

22500120.eight_factors:
• Utah dominated the offensive glass with a stellar 48% offensive rebounding rate, creating crucial second-chance opportunities that proved decisive in their narrow victory

• Phoenix struggled badly with ball security, turning the ball over at an alarming rate (11% turnover rate) that cost them dearly in this high-scoring affair

• Utah's shooting woes nearly derailed their home win, as they managed only a poor 48% effective field goal percentage in what should have been a more comfortable victory

• Phoenix couldn't capitalize on decent shooting (52% eFG%), failing to match Utah's energy on the boards despite connecting at a respectable clip

• Utah got to the charity stripe frequently with an impressive 32% free throw rate, adding valuable points in a game decided by just four points

• Phoenix couldn't crash the offensive boards effectively against Utah's interior defense, grabbing only 33% of their missed shots despite that mark being excellent by league standards

22500122.eight_factors:
• Los Angeles turned the ball over at an alarming rate, with just 79% ball security leading to a catastrophic offensive showing - the Lakers couldn't sustain drives or execute their halfcourt sets cleanly

• Portland dominated the offensive glass with an outstanding 39% offensive rebounding rate, creating numerous second-chance opportunities that extended possessions and wore down the Lakers defense

• The Lakers struggled from the field with subpar 51% effective field goal percentage, as Portland's stingy defense contested shots well and forced difficult looks throughout the game

• Portland managed to get to the charity stripe at a decent clip despite the Lakers playing aggressive defense, with Los Angeles committing enough fouls to send the Trail Blazers to the line at a 14% free throw rate

• Portland took care of the basketball reasonably well at 85% ball security, avoiding the costly turnovers that plagued Los Angeles and maintaining offensive flow in their road victory

22500118.eight_factors:
• San Antonio's scorching shooting performance was the primary catalyst in their dominant victory, converting an outstanding 68% of their field goal attempts when accounting for three-point value

• Toronto's abysmal effort on the defensive glass allowed San Antonio to capitalize on second chances, as the Spurs grabbed offensive rebounds on 27% of their misses while the Raptors managed just 3%

• Despite San Antonio's offensive explosion, the Spurs were careless with the basketball, turning it over on 21% of their possessions and giving Toronto extra opportunities they couldn't capitalize on

• San Antonio's aggressive approach to drawing contact paid dividends, getting to the free throw line at an exceptional rate with 45 free throw attempts per 100 field goal attempts

22500116.eight_factors:
• Houston's shooting was absolutely scorching, connecting at a sizzling 67% effective field goal rate that torched Brooklyn's defense and provided the biggest edge in this blowout victory

• Brooklyn dominated the offensive glass with a stellar 33% offensive rebounding rate, but Houston's defensive boards were lacking as they failed to finish defensive possessions consistently  

• Houston took excellent care of the basketball with a pristine 90% ball handling rate, while Brooklyn's defense struggled to generate the turnovers needed to fuel transition opportunities

• The Nets had major issues getting to the charity stripe, managing just a meager 14% free throw rate as Houston's disciplined defense avoided sending them to the line

• Houston was aggressive attacking the rim and drawing contact, earning trips to the free throw line at an impressive 27% rate while Brooklyn's defense racked up fouls
